text: Eugene Talmadge (September 23, 1884 â€“ December 21, 1946) was an American attorney and politician. He was the 55th governor of Georgia. He was elected to be governor three times but only served two time. He served from 1933 until 1937 and from 1941 until 1943. Talmadge died before he could be sworn in for the third time. He died of a liver problem. His death caused the three governors controversy. == References == Category:1884 births Category:1946 deaths Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Governors of Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Lawyers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Elected officials who died without taking their seats
title: Eugene Talmadge
